briefing.headline: A priceless sourdough starter has vanished to the far north!
briefing.narrativeHtml: Our bread history exhibit was robbed! Rumor says the thief chased glaciers and gold rush tales. Track him across Alaska.

rounds.clueHtml: He slipped north where glaciers meet the sea, a capital nestled along icy fjords, reachable mostly by boat or plane.
researchPrompts: US capital only by boat or plane
expectedProcess: Identify Juneau as Alaska’s capital with fjords
rounds.explainHtml: Juneau sits along the Gastineau Channel with nearby glaciers; no road access from the rest of Alaska.

rounds.clueHtml: Gold rush echoes follow a narrow-gauge railway over a snowy pass into Yukon territory.
expectedProcess: Connect to Skagway and White Pass & Yukon Route
rounds.explainHtml: Skagway boomed during the Klondike Gold Rush; the WP&YR climbs White Pass toward the Yukon.

resolution.summaryHtml:
• Geography: fjords capital with glacier access (Juneau)
  • History/Economics: Klondike era, White Pass railway (Skagway)
learningExtensions: Explore Alaska’s capitals and access routes
Map the Klondike Gold Rush trail
